title: interactive_analysis
text: vignette demonstrates explore air quality data stored sensor_data dataset, included jgb package. dataset comes PurpleAir sensors across SF Bay Area contains measurements air quality time.

title: interactive_analysis
text: Let’s load preview dataset: dataset contains columns representing coordinates, time, measured air quality values.

title: interactive_analysis
text: first split combined text field proper variables latitude, longitude, time, value.
code: if ("Coordinates_by_time.Time.Value" %in% names(sensor_data)) {   # Case 1: single combined column   sensor_clean <- sensor_data %>%   tidyr::separate(Coordinates_by_time.Time.Value,                   into = c("Coordinates", "Time", "Value"),                   sep = ",") %>%   tidyr::separate(Coordinates, into = c("lat", "lon"), sep = " ") %>%   mutate(     lat = as.numeric(lat),     lon = as.numeric(lon),     Value = as.numeric(Value),     time_num = as.numeric(gsub("T", "", Time))   )  } else if (all(c("Coordinates_by_time", "Time", "Value") %in% names(sensor_data))) {   # Case 2: already separate columns   sensor_clean <- sensor_data %>%       tidyr::separate(Coordinates_by_time, into = c("lat", "lon"), sep = " ") %>%     dplyr::mutate(     lat = as.numeric(lat),     lon = as.numeric(lon),     Value = as.numeric(Value),     time_num = as.numeric(gsub("T", "", Time))   )        } else {   stop("sensor_data has unexpected column structure. Check the dataset.") } head(sensor_clean) #> # A tibble: 6 × 5 #>     lat   lon Time  Value time_num #>   <dbl> <dbl> <chr> <dbl>    <dbl> #> 1  36.8 -122. T0     3.44        0 #> 2  36.8 -122. T1     3.04        1 #> 3  36.8 -122. T2     2.66        2 #> 4  36.8 -122. T3     2.4         3 #> 5  36.8 -122. T4     2.34        4 #> 6  36.8 -122. T5     2.19        5

title: interactive_analysis
text: following plot shows average air quality value across time points.
code: avg_trend <- sensor_clean %>%   group_by(time_num) %>%   summarise(mean_val = mean(Value, na.rm = TRUE))  ggplot(avg_trend, aes(x = time_num, y = mean_val)) +   geom_line(color = "#0072B2", linewidth = 1.2) +   geom_point(color = "#0072B2") +   geom_hline(yintercept = 500, color = "red", linetype = "dashed") +   labs(     x = "Time (T index)",     y = "Average Air Quality",     title = "Air Quality Trend Over Time"   ) +   theme_minimal()

title: interactive_analysis
text: explore dataset interactively, use Shiny app included package: app displays: - map view showing spatial air quality variation, - trend view displaying time evolution air quality levels.

title: interactive_analysis
text: vignette, explored sensor_data dataset, cleaned visualized , demonstrated access interactive Shiny app exploration.

code: @Manual{,   title = {jgb: Air Quality Explorer},   author = {Janhavi Bayanwar},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.1.0}, }

title: Air Quality Explorer
text: MyPackage provides cleaned dataset ETC5523 Assignments 3 based articleand interactive Shiny application allows users explore, visualize, analyze data dynamically. package designed teaching, learning, interactive data exploration. Dataset: sensor_data — cleaned, structured, ready Purple Air (kaggle). Shiny app: launch using launch_app() explore data interactively.

title: Air Quality Explorer
text: can install development version directly GitHub:
code: # install remotes if not already installed install.packages("remotes")  # install package remotes::install_github("assignment-4-packages-and-shiny-apps-Janhavi232009/jgb")  # Load the package library(jgb)

title: Air Quality Explorer
text: Load dataset Lauch interactive Shiny opens browser window interactive air-quality dashboard, can: Select sensors time periods View dynamic plots PM2.5 levels Compare air-quality metrics across groups Interpret data interactively

title: Air Quality Explorer
text: Full documentation, including function references, dataset details, vignettes, available pkgdown site: https://Janhavi232009.github.io/jgb
